That joke was lost on the foreigner; guides cannot master the subtleties of the American joke.

We have made it interesting for this Roman guide. Yesterday we spent three or four hours in the Vatican again, that wonderful world of curiosities. We came very near expressing interest sometimes, even admira- tion. It was hard to keep from it. We suc- ceeded, though. Nobody else ever did, in the Vatican museums. The guide was be- wildered‚ nonplussed. He walked his legs off, nearly, hunting up extraordinary things, and exhausted all his ingenuity, on us, but it was a failure; we never showed any interest in anything. He had reserved what he con- sidered to be his greatest wonder till the last ——a royal Egyptian mummy, the best pre-
